Review.Titre: Ordered cookie dough for my Grandson's…
Review.Contenu: Ordered cookie dough for my Grandson's fundraiser at Independance Middle school.  Gave CC number but never got the "dough" and never got a confirmation.  Not sure if I ever got charged as I can't find a record beyond, "Thanks for support" 2 Units?  How do I get in touch with Moneydolly?

Review.Titre: I only received one sweatshirt
Review.Contenu: I only received one sweatshirt. I ordered a man’s XXL shirt and was charged for it yet still have not received it!!!!

Review.Titre: I did not received my order I paid but…
Review.Contenu: I did not received my order I paid but didn't get my order.

Review.Titre: Biggest waste of time
Review.Contenu: Biggest waste of time. It charges for you to donate, and the numbers my kid put in there to send the texts to ( which the coach told him to put all adult numbers off his contacts which isn’t right to tell students to do since they didn’t get permission to give the numbers out) kept getting texts about it with no way to stop.

Review.Titre: Horrible platform and prizes
Review.Contenu: Horrible platform and prizes.  No one wants over priced popcorn.  The fees are reasons why some folks didn’t get a lot of supporters.  For improvement,  I would say have better things people can buy.  Get with vendors for perhaps gear or sport related items.  Snapraise was much better choices in my opinion.  They also had fees but lower than yours.

Review.Titre: I do not like this platform
Review.Contenu: I do not like this platform. I don't like being charged a fee to use my credit card OR having it mandatory to use a card to place an order. I also feel it is completely unfair to count 1 donation, regardless of the amount as "1 unit" towards the student's unit count. I also feel it is a poor choice not to have a direct ship option so those with family and friends who do not live nearby but who want to support and who want to receive "something" for their donation, ie they want to receive a box of cookie dough for their $25 donation towards the team.

Review.Titre: I’m so disgusted with this whole…
Review.Contenu: I’m so disgusted with this whole process. First it’s taking 2 months to get the cheesecakes, 2nd I just found out that the cheesecakes are being sent to the school so all of the out of state people that ordered a cheesecake won’t be able to get there’s. I’m going to have to personally cover the cost of that now and even though the cheesecakes have not been delivered the information is no longer in the app so I can’t even give people a heads up. My daughter was one of the top in sales but we will absolutely not do this again

Review.Titre: Still waiting on my order?? Still waiting??
Review.Contenu: Still waiting on my order?????and still waiting on my order almost 3 WEEKS!!! Please refund me my money… This seems to be a scam… Now December 12th???  No email confirmation… nothing… saga continues… oh my :(

Review.Titre: Disappointed
Review.Contenu: I am happy to hear that the Fullerton High School Song and Cheer team accomplished their goal but I never did receive the gift that I paid for

Review.Titre: The amount charge to my account was…
Review.Contenu: The amount charge to my account was twice as much as I selected to donate and there was no way to rectify the issue.

Review.Titre: I hate your platform
Review.Contenu: I hate your platform. You inundated me with constant give, give, give. It’s annoying and it’s not even having the child asking. I’d much prefer interaction with the child.

Review.Titre: I refuse to give out peoples phone…
Review.Contenu: I refuse to give out peoples phone numbers to a company I know nothing about.  It was annoying to receive 3 text messages, so any contacts I gave would have hated that.  Also not being allowed to choose a donation amount and being forced to give at least $25 is not feasible for a lot of people in this day and age.

Review.Titre: Impersonal and Lazy
Review.Contenu: It seems that a group “push” is the method used here to solicit people, rather than each potential buyer receiving an individual notification. This seemed cold, unprofessional, and unappreciative to me. We gave a donation, and were solicited again AFTER we had donated. Thinking the transaction didn’t go through, we gave ANOTHER donation.Even after giving 2 donations, we still were solicited to give yet again. This is a huge turnoff. I will think twice before purchasing from you again.Also, I think this is way too easy for the students. I expect them to put in some effort beyond sending a message to raise funds.

Review.Titre: Why must donating be so difficult?
Review.Contenu: Donating money online thru MoneyDolly is easy. Obtaining a hard copy of the donation for tax purposes is a royal pain. I donate regularly to my alma mater, Union Gospel Mission, Susan Komen and several religious charities. All of these provide, on the donation page, a one-click method for printing a 1-page receipt of the donation.  This receipt has minimal white space and shows: date of donation, gift amount, name & number of the source used to donate (VISA, Mastercard, etc), donor's name, recipient's name and a confirmation number.  MoneyDolly needs to get their head out and fix this issue for those who wish to donate to a cause that uses their service.

Review.Titre: My credit card was stole right after I…
Review.Contenu: My credit card was stolen right after I donated to this site. I know it was related to using this site, because I never use this particular card and 2 hours after I used it to donate there were charges hitting from all over. Terrible experience.

Review.Titre: Read the fine print!
Review.Contenu: Read the fine print!!  I may have missed the part where I agreed to allow users in my team that I have helped on previous fundraisers continue to have access to my contacts personal information for future fundraisers and allow them to use them without asking my permission to do the same on a separate fundraiser.  I also received calls asking if the fundraiser text was spam and complaints of the amount of communication is sent out on your behalf.  Before I did this fundraiser I probably would have done the same so let your contacts know ahead of time if possible.

Review.Titre: Bring back real cards
Review.Contenu: Having the opportunity to have a real card to sell to elder relatives and neighbors, would have given more sales. Not all people want the ap on phone and purchase with credit cards.   I know our grandson could have sold 10 more if they were just a card.

Review.Titre: Shocked and Disappointed
Review.Contenu: I was completely shocked to see how much the fees were for my purchases. It made me think and wonder how much the school actually receives from this fundraiser. The only reason why I gave it a one star rather than a no star, was because of the convenience of sending funds to the fundraiser. I would vote against having MoneyDolly associated with the fundraiser.

Review.Titre: I made donation first day and was…
Review.Contenu: I made donation first day and was repeatedly harassed for a donation. There has to be SOME way for donators not to have to put up with weekly harassment AFTER donating. Everyone I talked to admitted this was a flaw.

Review.Titre: I couldnt figure out how to sell the…
Review.Contenu: I couldnt figure out how to sell the items from the app or use a code for it - i felt the app was not easy for some reason mayb jus me idk

Review.Titre: I did not get any explanation as that…
Review.Contenu: I did not get any explanation as that what would occur. Texts were sent which caused a large amount of concern for friends and family. When I reached out, I was able to remove contacts but no one cared about the negative experience. I would NOT recommend.

Review.Titre: Do not use my review
Review.Contenu: I loved that each step was understandable (easy to follow). I was able to handle my contribution with each step telling me exactly “how to”. Having the choir member’s picture is a nice touch. It personalizes the whole experience, rather than a blank order form.

Review.Titre: Did not complete registration/circle
Review.Contenu: Did not complete registration/circle, yet app still took my contacts and would send pushy ghost messages out stating they were from me.  Felt embarrassed and privacy violated.  Some of my contacts are no longer speaking to me cause of the aggressive guilt sales tactics

Review.Titre: I have never been able to access the…
Review.Contenu: I have never been able to access the cards that were purchased. It was for our local football team and I would support them anyway, but it's a real bummer because my kiddos were looking forward to the deals on the cards.                              UPDATE, Trustplot fixed my issue the same day I filled out this survey. I thought it was just a lost cause. Thank you for fixing this I look forward to buying cards again this summer.

Review.Titre: problems with moneydolly
Review.Contenu: the man who came to talk to us about the app was a salesman, but not one that makes you feel comfortable. he was one that rubs you the wrong way, and was generally annoying. the pre made message that you send to people seems like a scam by the way it’s worded. i didn’t enjoy the fundraiser in the 2 years i’ve done them. they don’t feel genuine at all.

Review.Titre: Technical difficulties for many
Review.Contenu: Myself and others had a hard time using this program. It either had some technical bugs or something else, but many of us had to try to multiple times to get our donations to process. This issue may discourage others from donating as they may not try multiple times to get it to work properly.

Review.Titre: We were told it was tax deductible and…
Review.Contenu: We were told it was tax deductible and it’s not. We were told it was one price and ended up being more. No where on the flyer does it say plus processing fee. I don’t understand why it takes more money to process one $100 purchase than it does to process one $10 purchase. It clearly states that it’s for a tax deductible donation and that turned out to be false. Nowhere on the flyer does it state that the tax deduction is only for straight donations only

Review.Titre: Not enough information was given
Review.Contenu: Not enough information was given. I had no idea what MoneyDolly was or how it worked. Also, the coupons that the buyer could use were all for local establishments and I am a grandmother of the seller and I live out of state, I don't know if MoneyDolly is always for local businesses, or if the person selling the coupons didn't have enough information.

Review.Titre: Absolutely useless
Review.Contenu: Absolutely useless. If you are not able to actually answer customer concerns when they don’t get products in the way they are said to get them you are useless. Telling someone your just a 3rd party is passing the buck. If your going to handle a fundraiser then the delivery details should be explained during check out because I put in a shipping address only to find out my items were 2000 miles away at the participants school. I would have paid for shipping given the option.

Review.Titre: Limited locations
Review.Contenu: We bought $50 worth of coupons to support our grandson. However  the coupons were all local to the Dallas area. we are in San Antonio. Therefore we are unable to use any of the coupons We are very happy to contribute to the fund raiser for our grandson however if you could increase your area of businesses it would be a win win

Review.Titre: Worst possible method of fundraising for youth
Review.Contenu: I absolutely hated the online format. This is a difficult system to use and quite frankly very impersonal. Generally whenever there is a fund raiser, my child is responsible for doing the work to obtain support. My child makes rounds in the neighborhood or takes the packet to places like church or our workplaces. They get an understanding of the people and relationships that are involved with fund raising. The way this is set up, first off looks like a scam whenever people receive it as a text or email, but relies on the parents to recruit other adults in the child’s life to do the work for them. I hated this format and only participated this time as we were told this was a new program and it would be evaluated afterwards so I wanted to be able to give feedback. If it is offered again, I will not participate.

Review.Titre: Bothersome
Review.Contenu: My contacts sent me several messages complaining about the number of times they were sent texts, emails, etc. to ask for donations.  The minimum donation was $35 and quite often supporters would like to donate but they are not able to give $35, options for $10, $15, or $20 would have allowed us to receive more donations.

Review.Titre: Would rather the hand held card
Review.Contenu: Would rather the hand held card. Don’t need another app on my phone. Can’t give the “card” to my husband when he picks up dinner because I can only put the app on one phone. I forget about it. Haven’t used it once. Happy to support the kids, but I won’t be buying this virtual discount card again.

Review.Titre: Poor customer service
Review.Contenu: I just picked up my order and I was very disappointed to see I didn’t get what I paid for. Instead you sent a different item that we will not be eating as one of my kids is allergic to pecans. A courtesy email or phone call would have been nice so I can make the decision on what other cookie dough I would want instead you sent something that will be going to waste. I would still like to receive my item I ordered and paid for. Emailed almost a month ago and still not reply from anyone. I will not be part of this fundraiser again.

Review.Titre: Very impersonal
Review.Contenu: This was a very impersonal way to fundraise. I also didn't like that everyone could see who bought for an athlete, it actually caused some issue with friends and family buying for some and not all in a family.

Review.Titre: Junk fees charged to donors upon checkout, on top of charging the charity 20%.
Review.Contenu: The website is incredibly archaic.  The biggest issue is that you are charged a fee to donate money.  Never has any other fundraiser I have donated to charged a fee to donate.  This fee isn't disclosed until you go to check-out (like all junk fees).  MoneyDolly also keeps 20% of the money raised. So, I donated $100, plus on top of that was charged a fee.  They pass only 80% of what I donated, meaning $80 went to this cause.  They kept what ends up being a high percentage when you include the fee.  This practice is sketchy to say the least.

Review.Titre: Our son didn't receive credit for…
Review.Contenu: Our son didn't receive credit for donations received in addition to the cards he sold.  Most of our family is out of state.  They can't use the cards where they live, but wanted to donate.  We'd prefer the team just do a fundraiser and not fool with these cards in the future.

Review.Titre: Money Dolly’s use of past contacts
Review.Contenu: My daughter ended up sending this request out to people without our knowledge. It must have gone to people who formerly participated in a Money Dolly as she doesn’t have email addresses for some of them. We are really concerned about this strategy for boosting fundraising.

Review.Titre: Zero stars
Review.Contenu: Zero stars.  This fundraiser is essentially panhandling for kids, but worse.  The kids don’t even have to ask people for money.  They send texts out to their contacts asking for money, of which they only profit a portion & your company takes a portion.  Your representative comes in during school hours when parents aren’t around & makes the children feel like they have to comply with what they are being told.  I (parent) immediately upon receiving the text contacted my child’s contacts & told them not to “donate” because there would be more appropriate ways to donate in which my child would actually be taught values.

Review.Titre: $3 charge fee to fundraise per supporter
Review.Contenu: While fundraising supporters are paying a $3 fee to this company? Just use PayPal, cash app, or venmo if you want to support someone’s fundraiser to ensure all $ goes to the member.

Review.Titre: I hate this school fundraising garbage
Review.Contenu: I hate this school fundraising garbage!  The state and local governments should support our public schools!  The children should not be forced to ask people for money for activities that the public should step forward to fund.

Review.Titre: I watched the video
Review.Contenu: I watched the video, followed the directions and asked the teen who come by our house, but no one can tell me the code to get in once I've downloaded the app.  Very frustrating.  Won't recommend this app because there are too many steps and still couldn't get it to work.

Review.Titre: Truly Disappointed
Review.Contenu: I am disappointed in the gentleman who worked with us.  He was quite rude.  He had the students download the app and they were working together to help one another.  He didn't like the fact they didn't get quiet quick enough for him and was rude!  Next, he decided to not show up on the last day of the fundraiser to do the big finale because he thought our students were too rude.  I have to be honest, I have taught for 25 years and the students were just fine.  He was supposed to do a survivor activity where the students would win money and of course he canceled saying we were too rude.

Review.Titre: I recently supported the West…
Review.Contenu: I recently supported the West Springfield High School Baseball fundraiser, specifically in support of my nephew.  I did not like, that even though school officials shared with the public that each unit is equal to $35.00, my donation of $250.00 only reflected in the system as 1 unit of credit towards my nephew's fundraising.  No where were monetary donation values reflected, so that my nephew could see his progress compared to his teammates.  I did not like that at all, and hope my nephew was not penalized in any way for it.

Review.Titre: Donation fees and amounts
Review.Contenu: When someone donates, the donor should not have to incur fees.  Also donations should not start at 35.  with the economy the way it is, all parents, grandparents, friends, aunts, uncles should be able to contribute.  At the least, a $20 donation.  Many people live on fixed incomes or have more than one child to donate.  What happened to old fashioned cash options.

Review.Titre: I did not enjoy this fund raising…
Review.Contenu: I did not enjoy this fund raising experience at all. First I had to down load an app. An app that has very minimal purposes. No one wants another app. 2. The coupons are basically non transferable. You can transfer them once, to a person with the app (see above comment on no one wants another app). But then you can’t get them back. So if my daughter was going to a mall where she might use them without me I can’t transfer them and then get back unused ones ever. She would now be in possession forever. So basically I supported the organization with little hope of ever using the product they sold me.

Review.Titre: I received a card for Festival Foods
Review.Contenu: I received a card for Festival Foods, I redeemed my first coupon at the register and the checkout had no bar code or code to enter and couldn't do anything with it. The manager also didn't know how to use it.

Review.Titre: The “donation” feature is not explained…
Review.Contenu: The “donation” feature is not explained well. If a card is $25, and someone decides to just donate instead, a child or program should get credit for the monetary amount of the donation (i.e.- $100 donation = 4 cards, not 1 card + $75). It’s very misleading and will not use or contribute to this fundraiser again.

Review.Titre: The cinnamon buns were not worth the…
Review.Contenu: The cinnamon buns were not worth the money paid for them. The cost was $25 and the quality was lower than the ones that come in a can.  Also I ordered several packs and was charged a processing fee for each package. Very disappointed.

Review.Titre: Absolutely horrible
Review.Contenu: Absolutely horrible.  App doesn't allow simple donations.  App is spyware to the extreme.  If your school signs up for it, you won't have any choice.  But try to avoid if you can.

Review.Titre: Donations should count toward goals
Review.Contenu: This is a great way yo fundraise but please remove the donation tab if it won’t count toward the kids goal. Last year someone donated more than $100 snd they were angry when they found out it didn't help the student’s goal. People shouldn’t have to buy 10 cards. Count the donations or remove the tab. This is shady and defeating for the kids.

Review.Titre: Cost to much for the amount of jerky…
Review.Contenu: Cost to much for the amount of jerky per pack. Also hardly any of the money goes to the student. Next time I’m just going to donate the money straight to the school and ditch the middle man. Best of luck to you and your scam.

Review.Titre: My family and friends got very…
Review.Contenu: My family and friends got very aggravated with the repeated messages. Most of the ones said that they were not going to participate but still got messages and there is no way or easy way that I could find to remove them. Also, it makes it look like my son  is begging for money when in fact it is the app is doing this.My son was working hard to be able to go to the party and his understanding was that every twenty five dollars would be counted as a unit. I had several of my elderly family that reached out to me and didn't  want  to do the whole credit card thing, and they  just gave  me cash instead. Plus I have a couple friends that tried to donate and the app donated or charged more money than they were wanting to give. I also lost out on about fifty dollars because several people wanted to give 5 or ten but that was not allowed. You would think if you want money any amount would do. At this point I was not willing to front all of this money just so it could be donated.So therefore I just use my credit card after receiving cash from them so that he could get credit for multiple units.Instead the app only counted one unit when I had given seventy five dollars. I think there are a lot of glitches with this app and in the future we will not participate in thus.

Review.Titre: The festival card was very difficult to…
Review.Contenu: The festival card was very difficult to use and the store did NOT want to take it. It was very embarrassing to hold up the lines. i liked the regular cards  much better! I love to support the kids but I will not do the app purchase again :(

Review.Titre: Was just 0 point to this fundraiser
Review.Contenu: Was just 0 point to this fundraiser , was basically just giving money l… didn’t sell anything but “tiers”

Review.Titre: I haven’t gotten the product
Review.Contenu: I haven’t gotten the product.  Nothing in the confirmation email about delivery.  No update on delivery. No way to check or see delivery tracking. Went back to the site to try to see if there was any information and it’s closed for that fundraiser.

Review.Titre: Discount cannot be used
Review.Contenu: LA carreta in Rustburg will not recognize the discount because it is digital....our main reason to purchase the card.   Manager said he didn't authorize the discount card

Review.Titre: Not a fan how it continues to ask…
Review.Contenu: Not a fan how it continues to ask supporters for more money.

Review.Titre: I gave this fund-raising program a “1”…
Review.Contenu: I gave this fund-raising program a “1” rating because I received MULTIPLE texts/emails AFTER I ordered cookie dough. Those texts/emails asked me MULTIPLE times to purchase cookie dough and/or to donate.Because I had purchased cookies before I received those texts, it was very aggravating. I imagine your program was embarrassing for the cheerleaders and the cheer squad.I suspected these MULTIPLE requests  didn’t come from the cheer squad or the specific cheerleader, but instead came from a POORLY developed automatic fund-raising computer-generated program.  A good programmer should have been able to spot and correct this issue.

Review.Titre: Means of security not provided
Review.Contenu: Although I did use the App, I was very hesitant to do so. I could not find any information as to what kind of security is used. All I could find was that it was safe to use.  You may get more use if you can provide the means and type of security being used to keep user information secure.

Review.Titre: Molly Dolly Folly
Review.Contenu: I transferred Molly Dolly to my husbands phone and at first it did fine.  But then it started acting up - it would not pull up the card it would just circle around.  So I deleted the app and tried to re-add it to the phone but now it is asking me for a fundraising code-so I cannot use it.  I have sent two messages to Molly Dolly to try and resolve it but have not received a response still!

Review.Titre: MINIMUM DONATION a Big Assumption
Review.Contenu: I am really annoyed that the minimum donation is set by your app. $25 being the lowest donation is a high priced assumption for a youth baseball team.

Review.Titre: App issues
Review.Contenu: I had the Money Dolly app before this fundraiser and it worked fine. After purchasing this time, the app will never open. I have removed it a few times and reinstalled it but still the same issue.

Review.Titre: Mandatory Money Dolly
Review.Contenu: During the parent meeting, Coaches made it mandatory for each players family to open the Money Dolly account.  A few days later, the Coaches made each player sign up the Money Dolly account also.  Now our family has 2 accounts. I never finished my account.  I did not write anything asking my contacts to support my son.  Your colleagues took the liberty to do that for me without my consent.  Your system also sent messages out asking for support without our consent. I do not like the system asking anyone on our behalf for school support, using my son as the reason.  It make me feel I am not able to support my family.  I have had two contacts ask me "what's going on with Austin?"   "Is something wrong?'  I don't mind using the system for products to purchase as a fund raiser.  I do not like the system asking my family or friends for money to support my son in PHS football.  Its embarrassing and humiliating to me and my family.Many of our friends are retired and do not use social media for anything.  We don't either.

Review.Titre: whether it was money dolly or the…
Review.Contenu: whether it was money dolly or the school, it misrepresented student that wasn't even on the roster for the school, and so we donated , it was wrong

Review.Titre: I think it’s a scam that a $100…
Review.Contenu: I think it’s a scam that a $100 donation was the same as a $30 cup order. It should have counted as more than one unit. Unless that is changed, I will not participate in this fundraiser again.

Review.Titre: When someone buys you should get a…
Review.Contenu: When someone buys you should get a notification beep like the company used last year did last year every time someone bought we got a notification beep so you knew someone bought didn't have to go check to see like this year

Review.Titre: Must live in area to use coupons
Review.Contenu: I bought this thinking I could use anywhere in wisconsin, didn’t know coupons were only good in Madison area

Review.Titre: Do not like this type platform for…
Review.Contenu: Do not like this type platform for fundraising. Especially do not like platforms that in order to give a review must consent to having an account created.

Review.Titre: disappointing
Review.Contenu: contacts inundated with messages and i was unable to make payments to multiple students, all went to one and could not be corrected

Review.Titre: Exclusionary to the kids who need it most.
Review.Contenu: I found the app confusing to use, and their tiered ranking system downright deplorable. Offering a team an ice cream party only open to the kids who sell more product and purposefully excluding team members who don't have the parent support structure to sell the product is hazing and bullying behavior. The kids who need community the most are left out of group bonding experiences... it makes me sick.  A product that can not be shipped further narrows the window of support a child can gather in the event extended family or friend networks reside more than 20 miles away. Making monetary contributions - which benefit the organization more than sales anyway - more expensive than purchasing a product (that most people can't purcahse anyway) felt very slimy. Additionally, if a fiscal contribution is made, it doesn't benefit the child as much as selling the product. The rep couldn't answer any questions about the app and did a poor job of creating enthusiasm or confidence in the product. The amount of profit contributed back to the organization was low for industry standard as well. In the future I will not participate in Money Dolley fundraisers even if it means my child is at a disadvantage in her sport.

Review.Titre: I have never recieved the beef Jerry
Review.Contenu: I have never recieved the beef Jerry. I tracked it to Veradale post office but it was forwarded to my winter home in Arizona. Post office said there wasn't enough postage to send it there.

Review.Titre: Maybe not the App itself but didn’t…
Review.Contenu: Maybe not the App itself but didn’t appreciate that the minimum contribution was dictated to me at $35. Then even after I donated, the app asked me to support again?!

Review.Titre: Texting people I added at all hours of…
Review.Contenu: Texting people I added at all hours of the day and night, randomly and without my initiation of a message. I had to take our contacts off. We will not use the app again.

Review.Titre: Subpar Company - Not Worth It
Review.Contenu: I didn’t like that I couldn’t see how my daughter was doing sales-wise in comparison to her teammates. We are a very competitive family and normally we keep track of how each individual is doing and make sure our child is ahead by pushing harder, going out and getting more sales. Since we couldn’t see the progress, we didn’t push hard at all. Also, offering prizes makes for great incentives!When my daughter was first registering for this fundraiser, the instructions said to add contacts that are people who love and support her, but not family. That’s the dumbest idea ever. Family is who supports kids the most! We later went ahead and added family and that's when she started having success.You really ought to come up with better food options to sell. In past experience, the jerky from fundraisers like these are very subpar. And since we have dietary restrictions, jerky is our only option to buy.I know my daughter had lots of people make monetary donations but it never changed her goal total. That needs to change! Monetary donations are even better than sales of a subpar product.I definitely wouldn’t recommend using this fundraising platform to anyone unless major changes are made first. Good try though!

Review.Titre: I never received my order of popcorn…
Review.Contenu: I never received my order of popcorn that I placed in November of 2022! But I noticed my credit card was charged the very day I placed the order. Will not be ordering anything else in the future.

Review.Titre: Email reminders to donors
Review.Contenu: You continued to email people that had ready donated each week.  That was embarrassing and terrible.   Once someone donates, please take them OFF the email reminder list.  Thank you.

Review.Titre: No need to keep sending reminders once…
Review.Contenu: No need to keep sending reminders once my purchase gas been made. Also seems like it's phishing link when it comes through.

Review.Titre: Never received coupon or any type of…
Review.Contenu: Never received coupon or any type of confirmation, still have not.  No feedback or type of direction on how redeem.  Just NOTHING.

Review.Titre: It’s a shame we have to pay extra money…
Review.Contenu: It’s a shame we have to pay extra money to be able to contribute to our school functions. This money is suppose to help the kids not some company 😥

Review.Titre: The app doesn’t work
Review.Contenu: The app doesn’t work, I’ve tried using it on the Internet as well, and requires many additional steps of logging in and such, and is more a pain to try to use. Not Worth the hassle.

Review.Titre: We did not like that it sent multiple…
Review.Contenu: We did not like that it sent multiple reminders to our family- even to the people who had already donated! It was embarrassing.

Review.Titre: Hard to navigate
Review.Contenu: Hard to navigate. Could never get actual fundraising screen to open on my end. Lack of options for fundraising, and too high priced.

Review.Titre: Every time I tried to contribute  an…
Review.Contenu: Every time I tried to contribute  an error message came up saying it could not load The pageI was unable to contribute on my phone,I had to do it on my son's phone

Review.Titre: A $35 minimum is ridiculous
Review.Contenu: A $35 minimum is ridiculous. If people want to donate $5 they should be able to. Every donation helps. Then adding a fee on top of the donation is sad. I do not like this fundraiser type and would not recommend.

Review.Titre: The money dolly app is glitchy
Review.Contenu: The money dolly app is glitchy. It doesn't work consistently. Local vendors are always confused when you try to use the deals.

Review.Titre: We never received our items
Review.Contenu: We never received our items. Several people that ordered from my son are asking about items. Who do we contact to see about receiving items??

Review.Titre: This is the biggest joke
Review.Contenu: This is the biggest joke. The fact that y'all get access to the kids contacts and "bot" the former supporters is so disgusting. I hate this platform and think it's criminal. Y'all should all be ashamed

Review.Titre: Does not ship to recipient
Review.Contenu: I received everyone’s order. They sent it to the school and it was picked up by the student, real inconvenient for those who ordered and live out of town. Now I have to ship the orders to them.

Review.Titre: I got charged for something I never…
Review.Contenu: I got charged for something I never received why ask for someone’s address if you’re not going to send them the items

Review.Titre: After I donated I continued to receive…
Review.Contenu: After I donated I continued to receive requests for donations? The person whose name I donated for never informed me of the donation?

Review.Titre: I purchased it in sep or oct and…
Review.Contenu: I purchased it in sep or oct and suddenly recently I looked to use it and what do you know, all the discounts had disappeared so yes I was not too pleased.

Review.Titre: Difficult to use
Review.Contenu: The money card has not worked at any of the restaurants so far. The owners appear to not know about the card or how to apply the discount without a QR code to scan.

Review.Titre: Physical cards were So much easier to…
Review.Contenu: Physical cards were So much easier to sell… we sold 40 cards last year- this year only 13…. Very frustrating

Review.Titre: Frustrating
Review.Contenu: The cards are were pretty good, but large donations should count for more than one card. A $100 donation should count for 5 cards. It’s pretty crappy. Players had lots of money donated, but the only thing that mattered was how many cards they sold. Frustrating.

Review.Titre: We sold a bunch of cards that people…
Review.Contenu: We sold a bunch of cards that people weren't able to even download on their phones and use. It needs to be more user friendly for the older generation

Review.Titre: Scammers used my email.
Review.Contenu: You shared my email with a certain Kayden Cherida.  It's not appreciated. I wanted to support. Now I won't.

Review.Titre: I haven’t been able to use it since…
Review.Contenu: I haven’t been able to use it since August . It just shows a woman and never opens . There have been  many comments about this and you never fixed the problem !  I would never recommend this Fund Raiser

Review.Titre: Paid for fundraiser card and never got…
Review.Contenu: Paid for fundraiser card and never got it. No link, no email, no instructions. NOTHING

Review.Titre: Then I had to pay out of pocket to mail…
Review.Contenu: Then I had to pay out of pocket to mail cookies or pay people and get stuck with their cookies they did not want anymore

Review.Titre: Frankly it's just too expensive
Review.Contenu: Frankly it's just too expensive.  The two products our girls were asked to sell were popcorn and beef jerky, both were $30.  There was also a donate $ option, but with predetermined denominations, starting at I think $35.  Our daughter was embarrassed to ask our friends and family for this type of commitment so close to Christmas.  While obviously, there's a few who have the disposable income and/or the heart for giving in support of the team, there are many others who do have the heart for giving, just not that much.  We need cheaper options, both in products and in donation only increments. She would have likely garnered many more donations and purchases with 5-10-15 dollar options.

Review.Titre: Disappointing
Review.Contenu: If a site is collecting money, the donation amounts should not be pre-populated. The donor should be given an option of how much they feel comfortable giving. And the site should allow the additional fee to come out of the donation amount imstead of tacking on more money at checkout. I was disappointed with this fundraising platform.

Review.Titre: The process itself was simple
Review.Contenu: The process itself was simple. What I had a problem with was the $35 minimum donation. Really? Just skipped right over $20. If anyone else sends me this platform, I will NOT make a donation. That’s way too high for a minimum. Bunk.

Review.Titre: The cost per donation made it very…
Review.Contenu: The cost per donation made it very unappealing. Half our donors went direct to the school and knowing what I know now I will be doing the same in the future. Additionally, the level of spam/reminder texts were annoying. Should only have one reminder text just prior to campaign ending. Lastly, a thank you text on behalf of the person would be appropriate.

Review.Titre: Wish the school would host fundraisers themselves
Review.Contenu: Your fees are ridiculous and based on the donation amount. Last app the school used was half the amount. The school would be better off hosting these fundraisers themselves instead of outsourcing. Also, when a person donates anonymously, it should remain anonymous. An email should not be sent to the child's parent stating who donated and how much they donated. At the very least, when a donor wants to be anonymous then the email should also say "anonymous".

Review.Titre: Preset giving amounts Inhibit some from donating
Review.Contenu: I really wanted to give something, and it was going to be a very small amount, and I thought a small amount is better than no amount but then I saw the minimum. I had pretty much decided that I was going to give the family money directly. For a very specific reason I did make a donation through the app but I doubt that I’ll do that again if it comes up. There are grandparents and friends that are on fixed incomes that will be able to give something but things or so stretched for so many people that it makes that giving the minimum too big a sacrifice. This wasn’t exactly the case for me, so that was not my reasoning for not giving. Instead, it was that I felt coerced into giving a particular amount.

Review.Titre: The additional fees attached to…
Review.Contenu: The additional fees attached to people’s orders is completely unnecessary especially if they are providing a monetary donation. Also the excessive emails/texts to people whose numbers we’ve provided is embarrassing. Way too pushy and quite the turn off to those who haven’t donated yet but intend to. Also had multiple people tell me that they received emails/texts when their spouse had already donated.

Review.Titre: Skipping It Next Time.  - I don't like that I couldn't chose an…
Review.Contenu: I don't like that I couldn't chose an amount that I would want to contribute. There were preset amounts only. There an additional fee for using the service. I continued to receive spam texts from this event about donating after I already donated. I now have received spam texts every day from other companies immediately following this event. I don't give my cell phone out so seems to be a direct relation to MoneyDolly.

Review.Titre: Disappointed with the "unit" calculations
Review.Contenu: I'm VERY disappointed on how goal "units" are calculated.   I am helping my nephew (along with others) to reach the set target goal of 25 units so donated more than $25.  After I hit the pay button I learned that no matter how much is donated only one unit credit is awarded.  (ex: each unit requires $25 donation if you donate $100 only one unit is awarded vs four)  Recommendation:  MoneyDolly add this to the donation page to make sure the kids get an accurate credit count

Review.Titre: I loved the idea but not the process
Review.Contenu: I loved the idea behind the digital format but since the cards were limited to a small area we found it difficult to sell a digital card to strangers. We don’t have family in the area to sell to. Last year we had the physical card and my son was able to walk around on Halloween and sell everything he had on hand. This year he attempted the same thing and not a single person was interested since it wasn’t a physical card. Also the minimum requirement for a monetary donation was to high. We tried to get family from out of town to do donations but they ended up purchasing a card that they couldn’t use just to go with the cheaper option. Finally, when a person uses the digital format for to purchase a card or donation they are charged a fee. This turned away so many people because they wanted to do a simple $20 donation but was charged a fee to do so. As a small business owner I understand the price of service fees being passed onto the consumer but fundraisers should NEVER have a fee attached to them.

Review.Titre: The app was easy to use, but small issues
Review.Contenu: The app was easy to use except when sending the messages there were 2 problems. One, people couldn't tell that the requests were coming from my Mom's phone & thought she was giving out staff numbers to me (student) which got her into trouble. Second when the repeated texts came through some customers were turned off by it & it caused them to not purchase because it was pushy due to the fact that I was already contacting them & didn't know that there were texts automatically going through.

Review.Titre: I think you charge entirely too much to…
Review.Contenu: I think you charge entirely too much to process a credit card payment.

Review.Titre: Too difficult for our older family…
Review.Contenu: Too difficult for our older family members to donate to the fundraiser.   It was a lot of juggling on our part to make their donations happen.  Our school lost money if family or friends couldn’t figure the technology out or simply didn’t want to register.   👎🏻

Review.Titre: Online only option made it difficult to sell
Review.Contenu: It was difficult to sell because you had to have people go online to buy it.  I wish that I could have sold them from a paper like we use to do things.  I like having the online option but I don't feel like it should be the only option.  I also didn't like that there were fees added on to the sale.  If a paper option was available would it avoid those fees?

Review.Titre: it was too impersonal
Review.Contenu: it was too impersonal. Large donations need a bit of a personal touch, not a robotic email with robotic responses. Each child should have to respond directly. My nephew never actually reached out to me himself and never said thank you until I advised him of my donation. it may seem to be asking alot of a 14 or 15 yr old, but that is how children can learn today. hiding behind robots is not a long term answer for personal requests of support. this is my opinion only, but i would not donate again unless the system was changed.

Review.Titre: Too many text notifications
Review.Contenu: Too many text notifications. Money was allocated to only one of my students, not both equally as I had intended to donate separately into their individual accounts. Very few choices of items to order.

Review.Titre: The process was a little annoying and…
Review.Contenu: The process was a little annoying and also didn't appeal to some older neighbors who prefer having things in their hands vs. on their phones (a card vs an app, etc)

Review.Titre: Frustrated
Review.Contenu: I understand the importance of fundraising, but I feel like money dolly doesn’t calculate units sold in regards to donations.  If a card cost 25 dollars, and a grandparent decides to just give a donation of 100.00, why does that count for 1 unit instead of 4.  If that is indeed the case, then explain that in the link so donors understand how credit is given.

Review.Titre: From the old school!
Review.Contenu: I am an older senior citizen that participated in this program. I am not computer savvy. Before they sold cards, which to me would have been preferred. My grandson could have sold more that way because it was more wanted than having to use a phone to access the discounts.I can understand that most people uses a debit card. But I come from a paper coupon generation.

Review.Titre: I try to help support my grandson but…
Review.Contenu: I try to help support my grandson but there needs to be just and option to donate money without having to buy the tickets.   I do not live in Allen I live almost an hour away and those tickets mean nothing to me.  But in order to help him I had to buy the tickets.    Make just a donation option would be helpful.

Review.Titre: We had older people try to buy items…
Review.Contenu: We had older people try to buy items but if their credit card wasn't set up as saved in their device wallet app it wasn't letting them set up a card for payment. They decided it wasn't worth the effort to giving the platform. Also, there was no description of the items that you were buying - size, quantity, flavors, or ingredients. We had a hard time getting anyone to order.

Review.Titre: I now have received all my order.I give your organization 5 huge stars!!So satisfied! Thank you for everything.
Review.Contenu: I haven't received my 2 different orders. Then I will be able to express my opinion. Thank you. Wish the school good luck.I give your organization 5 big stars!!!I have now received 3 bags of the caramel corn. I paid for 4 bags so I am short 1 bag. I trust you will make it right. No mention in the bag of 1 bag missing. Marjorie Newcomb

Review.Titre: Too many texts
Review.Contenu: The app texted potential supporters multiple times and then I would receive texts from family or friends stating their frustration with this app.  I won’t do this next year!!!  😡😡

Review.Titre: Please give the option for supporters…
Review.Contenu: Please give the option for supporters to choose how much they want to donate to a fundraiser.  Not giving supporters options deters fundraising opportunities.

Review.Titre: No Monetary Goal to Work Toward
Review.Contenu: Not being able to see an actual financial goal or how much of the financial goal was raised was harmful as I had many people asking "how much do we still need to raise" and it was very complicated trying to explain the "units approach". Several opted not to donate as a result. Also, not being able to give unless you gave $35 minimum was not helpful. I understand that to qualify for the drawing, but people should at least be able to give $10 and feel valued if that's all they can give.

Review.Titre: Some cards just not worth it.
Review.Contenu: I purchased a card from the high school football team and there were a variety of food options, gas stations, oil changes, UPS, etc.  Then I purchased a card from the high school swim team & that card has three choices. Two are food (one which is pizza) & one coffee shop.  I am disappointed the football card has over 20 different places to use but for the same price the swim team only offers three choices. I don't know if in the future I would support the swim team card due to the lack of options.

Review.Titre: I kept getting the same notice about…
Review.Contenu: I kept getting the same notice about the child needing my help to purchase for band even after I had already purchased the item   It sounded like I didn’t order anything

Review.Titre: There is no personal interaction
Review.Contenu: There is no personal interaction. Also, we dislike the continuous auto-generated texts your company sends out begging people to buy. It makes it seem like the players are being rude.

Review.Titre: I think it was easy to use
Review.Contenu: I think it was easy to use. However, the downside is is that when your people donated already you still continue to send random messages asking for donations, thats rude, to keep asking for a donation after someone already donated . Also, you send random messages asking for donations on days like Mother’s Day For instance. Nobody wants to be bothered with a Fundraiser on Mother’s Day.

Review.Titre: Our friends received way too many text…
Review.Contenu: Our friends received way too many text / email reminders. They were annoyed. Even the ones who already donated received multiple reminders.

Review.Titre: Very disappointed with this fund…
Review.Contenu: Very disappointed with this fund raiser!  They kept hounding me for a donation even after I made one.  I had to check with my relative to make sure this wasn't a new / different campaign.  I asked MoneyDolly to stop texting me and they offered no way for me to opt out.  I encourage charities to realize how much they may alienate their membership by using this type of approach.  I think I got around six texts even after I donated.Also, I had no way to easily find out how much my granddaughter had raised.  That should be basic.Edit:  I DID use the "STOP" feature on my phone but that did not stop the texts from arriving.  I DID contact their support but got no response.

Review.Titre: Way too guilt-inducing.
Review.Contenu: I was VERY unhappy with the fact that I was inundated with way too many choices and guilt-inducing 'choices' and 'supporter levels' before I could just buy the product that I promised my student I'd buy.Make it simple.  Make it quick. Drop the guilt. I dread using this program again.The only cool thing was the ability to send a message to the team. This warrented 2 stars instead of 1.Referencing MoneyDolly's reply of 8/29:  I am not talking about the messaging.  I am talking about the webpages you have to scroll through to get to the product you are buying, that have a zillion expensive levels before you reach your paltry overpriced product.

Review.Titre: App needs improvement
Review.Contenu: It was slightly difficult to set up but I managed.  I couldn't find it, but you should have the ability to to put multiple kids on the same phone number.  I have 4 kids that were selling the card but we only have two phone numbers, so 2 kids were out of luck.

Review.Titre: Catch twenty two!
Review.Contenu: You guys didn't say their will be a processing charge for every unit purchased for the amount of $1.50 each. For example I bought 4 units it cost me 6$. It doesn't show up until check out.. That's not right for you'll to get rich of the Generous donation for these kids to enjoying play the sports.

Review.Titre: Not worth the hassel
Review.Contenu: The taste of the cookies were mediocre. It would be more beneficial for the company to ship the cookies instead of me having to collect the cookies once they came in and then distribute and ship myself. I spent more money shipping the cookies than what they cost to order. Also the option to donate wasn’t counted equally with what it would be if the person purchased cookies. If our team chose this fundraiser again, I would just make a flat donation instead of purchasing any cookies. It was more of a burden than other fundraisers have been in the past for our family and less of a financial gain than others would have offered.

Review.Titre: Alot of vendors were placed in  wrong…
Review.Contenu: Alot of vendors were placed in  wrong categories and incorrect  descriptions of what we receive with coupon. Also some people try to argue the cupon

Review.Titre: Our support person was rarely available…
Review.Contenu: Our support person was rarely available and slow to respond to inquiries, if at all.  There was a vendor that wouldn't cooperate and upset a customer.  And our app was shut down early and had to be reset; this meant for a time our customers were unable to use.

Review.Titre: Minimum too high
Review.Contenu: The platform is really easy to use, however, the $35 minimum is a bit much especially with a processing fee. There should be an option to enter the amount you want to pay. The minimum may have been set by the school, but the processing fee is still a bit much. I think more could have been raised if there was a lower minimum.

Review.Titre: Accounting for donations
Review.Contenu: I bought a coupon book and gave a donation in the amount of 4 coupon books. This only counted as 1 unit and was equal to 5 units. Also, higher donations should count as more than one unit.  Sales tax should not be paid on donations.

Review.Titre: i would rather write a check or donate…
Review.Contenu: i would rather write a check or donate cash rather than acquired a credit card processing fee but that was not an option. credit card fees should not be passed off to the donation

Review.Titre: You have to be able to transfer coupons…
Review.Contenu: You have to be able to transfer coupons some how.In response to Money Dolly’s response to my review…. I suggested that you find a way to transfer “coupons” not cards.  I understand you can transfer the whole “card” or book.  I’m suggesting you be able to transfer individual coupons - not the whole book.  I have 5 ppl in my family that would use individual coupons differently but you’re not able to transfer the individual coupon. It was a fundraiser so I’m happy that I participated, but it’s not user friendly to be able to redeem for the whole family.

Review.Titre: Supporters options
Review.Contenu: I feel there should be a better system for donations. Supporters should be able to have option of how much they are willing to support. A minimum of $35 was a lot and then tax was added on. Also there was not much of a variety with the popcorn. My supporters was looking for different sizes and options.

Review.Titre: Suggestions for improvement
Review.Contenu: The amount of contribution should be less than the minimum of $35. We lost sponsors because of that. Also, allow the customers to decide if they want to pay the service fee or take it out of the profits- even church’s do this.

Review.Titre: Your website is not user friendly,,I…
Review.Contenu: Your website is not user friendly,,I was unable to donate online and had to give it directly to the staff. Have someone, like a grandparent of the fundraiser try to access and donate; someone who is able to access everything they need,,,and see what happens. I just wanted to donate, not put people on my list,,

Review.Titre: Too difficult for many grandparents to…
Review.Contenu: Too difficult for many grandparents to use whereby causing the team to miss out on hundreds of $$$.  Personally we don’t use charge cards.

Review.Titre: I prefer an actual card I can carry on…
Review.Contenu: I prefer an actual card I can carry on me for 2 reasons. First, it is a reminder to use it. With all the business' listed it's a constant reminder to go there and use it. Secondly, as an advertiser on this program we have seen a sharp decline in people using the discount. It's not increasing more customers to shop at my store.

Review.Titre: More negative feedback than positive
Review.Contenu: Taking 20% of our donations is ridiculous. Luckily I only had 2 ppl do it because they were never given our team Venmo so they can donate and 100% of it gets to the team. $30 for 3 small bags of jerkey is a ripoff too. It’s super hard to sell. The only positive things are how it’s easy to send out the link and that we don’t have to worry about handling payment or delivering the product. Tracking for delivery should be available as soon as money is paid. Not when fundraiser closes. That kept 3 of my supporters from getting their Christmas gift jerkey in time for Christmas.

Review.Titre: When listing the places that you get…
Review.Contenu: When listing the places that you get discounts, it did not say specific locations until after you paid. They are mostly for specific locations in Princeton. I don’t live in Princeton.

Review.Titre: No Fees Please
Review.Contenu: The process was easy enough. The process fees were sad. Trying to raise money for a group of children to continue to participate in sports should NOT carry fees.

Review.Titre: I bought a card that never showed up in…
Review.Contenu: I bought a card that never showed up in the app. Purchased a second card because he needed one more to make 20 and it did work. People were frustrated over the reminder texts that kept being pushed through. It makes no sense to have a minimum donation of $35 when the cards only cost $25. Out of town family and friends do not want to buy a card and some didn’t give anything because of the limit

Review.Titre: I much prefer the physical cards
Review.Contenu: I much prefer the physical cards. We only sold a fraction of what we sold last year because people didn't want to get the app.

Review.Titre: Minimum required donation - thumbs down
Review.Contenu: Any donation amount should be acceptable.  I was very disappointed in the minimum required amount.  It was more than I wanted to donate.

Review.Titre: Too many emails
Review.Contenu: Payment part was fine. But I got way too many emails about the fundraiser, even after I had donated. Absolutely ridiculous. If the emails weren’t from money dolly , I apologize for the low rating.

Review.Titre: Update shipping methods
Review.Contenu: Ordering was easy, however, Molly Dolly should add a link that allows customers to where they’d like to have orders shipped to. My order was shipped to an address I no longer reside.

Review.Titre: No choice in $ amount
Review.Contenu: I lost 3 donors because they were not able to choose their $ amount . I do believe that by forcing people to donate at least $35 is just greedy.

Review.Titre: You did not show me how to benefit from…
Review.Contenu: You did not show me how to benefit from my donation. I do not know what discounts are available and do not know where to get the app. Confusing that you did not let me know what businesses are available.

Review.Titre: It is hard to use, not everything received
Review.Contenu: It is hard to use. I thought I oder three bags of popcorn because everything was in threes and we only received one bag of popcorn. I am not sure but thought we ordered some beef jerky too. Either way our order was not complete and no information was received with food to call and try to make it right.

Review.Titre: Getting the app to work is hit or miss
Review.Contenu: Getting the app to work is hit or miss. Have not been able to gey access to my fundraiser card on several occasions. Will likely skip purchasing another card

Review.Titre: Never ending loop
Review.Contenu: I got into a never ending loop of it asking for my card number, me putting it in, it saying something was missing, sending me back to the beginning, etc. I ultimately had to do it on my computer as opposed to my phone. Very time consuming and frustrating.

Review.Titre: The fundraiser was extended by 5 days then ended 1 day early
Review.Contenu: The fundraiser was extended by 5 days.  Then on the last day there was 13 hrs left....for some reason it ended early!!!!!  We had at least 5 more cards to enter - people had paid us but we hadn't had time to do it yet.    Not sure why it was extended 5 days just to end it early with no warning!!!!!

Review.Titre: The % money dolly charges is absurd
Review.Contenu: The % money dolly charges is absurd. To have such an unfriendly user platform, to charge so much is wrong. I would rather donate in person, to avoid that much paid to a sub par checkout ap. Almost didn’t donate having to go through them.

Review.Titre: Send items purchased sooner
Review.Contenu: Send items purchased sooner. It's been a couple weeks and still haven't heard any news of my item shipping

Review.Titre: Did not go as well as I had hoped President
Review.Contenu: Did not go as well as I had hoped.  Players were having difficulty registering and supporters thought event was a scam because my name was used with a MoneyDolly  number

Review.Titre: It was easy to donate
Review.Contenu: It was easy to donate. But .... Money Dolly could up their game by sending donors email or text notification to use the item purchased. Provide more than a money service.

Review.Titre: People were not a fan of this…
Review.Contenu: People were not a fan of this fundraiser. It was very complicated for me to set up and I had no idea what was sent to who. People did not like that you had to choose set increments to donate to, and the fact that there is a few donate is absurd. Once I understood how to use the app it was easy to manage.

Review.Titre: I donated $250 and instead of a THANK…
Review.Contenu: I donated $250 and instead of a THANK YOU, I continued to get inundated with text messages asking for more money!

Review.Titre: The platform and concept is great
Review.Contenu: The platform and concept is great. The variety of items to purchase is very limited. It’s been two months or better and still haven’t received the items we ordered.

Review.Titre: Making those who donate responsible for…
Review.Contenu: Making those who donate responsible for credit card fees is disappointing.

Review.Titre: I have not received my product and i…
Review.Contenu: I have not received my product and i have not gotten any updates on the shipping either. I paid for the item weeks ago and still haven’t received anything or any updates

Review.Titre: I was not able to download the app for…
Review.Contenu: I was not able to download the app for use and did not find the vendors particularly ones I would use. Looked at this as just a donation to Midlothian HS football team.

Review.Titre: I had difficulty redeeming my Festival…
Review.Contenu: I had difficulty redeeming my Festival Foods coupon off the Festival Food ca4d that was purchased for thw donation They never heard of it at Festival Foods I went to.

Review.Titre: I think it would be better if the app…
Review.Contenu: I think it would be better if the app didn’t send out messages by itself. I had people who got 3 messages from the app that I didn’t send

Review.Titre: train kids better!
Review.Contenu: student did little to introduce/explain what he was selling,(without prompting from me) didn't seem that familiar with product, and couldn't answer questions about how to use the payment system.

Review.Titre: Having to update an app just to use a…
Review.Contenu: Having to update an app just to use a coupon. Didn't use a coupon because it would take too long to update app first. A coupon should be straight forward to use.

Review.Titre: It loses the personal touch and the…
Review.Contenu: It loses the personal touch and the automated text messages are obnoxious.

Review.Titre: The kids was not clearly told what to…
Review.Contenu: The kids was not clearly told what to do and how many units they needed to get to get a jacket. Some kids said  that they needed 20 units. Some kids said they needed 25. So us parents was not sure.

Review.Titre: My son sold 16 cards and did not…
Review.Contenu: My son sold 16 cards and did not receive all the prizes that was due.

Review.Titre: Download trouble
Review.Contenu: The app never did download correctly on my phone so I never have used any of the deals. Big disappointment.

Review.Titre: The purchase choices were EXTREMELY…
Review.Contenu: The purchase choices were EXTREMELY limited - nothing i really liked. And... it took 7 weeks to arrive!

Review.Titre: Too complicated to check out
Review.Contenu: Too complicated to check out. I wanted to use PayPal and ended up have to enter my CC account.

Review.Titre: Could be better
Review.Contenu: I didn't like the repeat emails which happened even after you had donated.

Review.Titre: not enough good choices that people…
Review.Contenu: not enough good choices that people really want.. cups and popcorn, pretzels and beef jerky is not it.

Review.Titre: Hated that the convince fee was per…
Review.Contenu: Hated that the convince fee was per item and not per transaction. The charges really racked up.

Review.Titre: I’m still waiting for half of my order…
Review.Contenu: I’m still waiting for half of my order I placed back in November.

Review.Titre: Expensive cookie dough
Review.Contenu: Expensive cookie dough. Cookies do not taste good.

Review.Titre: Overly complicated and out to gouge…
Review.Contenu: Overly complicated and out to gouge every penny possible.

Review.Titre: I never received my wreath
Review.Contenu: I never received my wreath.  Money seemed to go through by t not sure if it was received by the school.

Review.Titre: After you give once….stop sending…
Review.Contenu: After you give once….stop sending emails asking for more. One ask is enough!

Review.Titre: No thank you.
Review.Contenu: Prefer not to comment. Changed my mind. No use contacting me.

Review.Titre: Did not receive a receipt
Very impersonal and presumptuous
Review.Contenu: Very impersonal and presumptuous.  I'm being asked to contribute, to donate, yet with little personal attachment

Review.Titre: Limited
Review.Contenu: Not personal. Too few options.

Review.Titre: Took three times to complete order
I have never received my purchases
extra fee online is too much
Review.Contenu: The fee online is too much extra cost

Review.Titre: I resent your fees
Review.Contenu: I resent your fees. Why must I pay money to donate?

Review.Titre: The amount of notifications received…
Review.Contenu: The amount of notifications received made me and my participants uncomfortable, thinking possible scammers

Review.Titre: I am trying to use it right now and it…
Review.Contenu: I am trying to use it right now and it won't load.

Review.Titre: Not very user friendly
The process was easy
Review.Contenu: The process was easy. I appreciated that. I didn't appreciate the service charge. I didn't like that people had to donate a minimum amount. They should be able to donate any amount that is affordable for them.

Review.Titre: Delivery of product
Review.Contenu: Your time line for product delivery and notification is very slow.  Why can't you go ahead and ship the product when you receive payment? Why do we have to wait almost 30 days to receive it?  When i purchase from Amazon, I receive my order within a few days. If its about money, maybe you should give the option for people to pay more for postage so they can get their order within a week and not 30 days or more. I usually never buy from a company that says it will be 30 days before they ship when I've already paid my money

Review.Titre: Too many texts
Review.Contenu: My criticism is the amount of follow-up texts it sends “on behalf” of the person. I understand it’s used as a reminder, but in financially trying times it comes as baggage. People will donate or they won’t, but there’s no need to reach out to them after the initial ask. If the texts continue after the fundraiser ends for advertisement purposes, I will definitely not use the app again in the future.

Review.Titre: Don't pre-select donor amounts
Review.Contenu: I did not like the fact that you didn't allow ME to select the amount I wanted to give. You predetermined the amounts one could give---starting with a minimum of $35.You would get a better response if you allowed the donor to select what he or she CHOOSES  to give.

Review.Titre: The app was great but given they should…
Review.Contenu: The app was great but given they should have gotten one one unit per 25 dollars they app should reflect  that.  That way everyone will know exactly where they stand and it could create more money donated.  For example if a child had 30 units and another child had 30 units one of them may have pushed harder to get 31 to win over all units.  Since the app only gave one unit for a hundred dollars you never know where you stand against others.  You can figure out how many total units you have if you added them based on your sales but not how many others have so you don’t know if you’re winning even if it says you’re winning.

Review.Titre: When people order more than one thing…
Review.Contenu: When people order more than one thing it only counts as one i think it should count as two same thing with the donations

Review.Titre: Don't like the Fee
Review.Contenu: I would rather donate directly to the organization that is raising money for.  I don't like the 'fee' that was added.  I do realize that this organization needs funds to be a business.  It was pretty easy to make the donation.  But, there is so much FRUAD in the world today, that I shy away from things I am not familiar with.  When I first saw this email in my Inbox, my first thought was it was SPAM.  I do support other businesses and charities that don't charge a fee and 100% still goes to the charity.

Review.Titre: My message was not posted on the…
Review.Contenu: My message was not posted on the donation wall,  was it because I wrote it in spanish? I didn't write anything offensive. That is why I rate my experience with 3 stars. Other than that it was very user friendly.

Review.Titre: Easy to fundraise, but be aware
Review.Contenu: The app os easy to navigate both for the people raising and the people supporting. However, beware- if you add your contacts to your circle, and send one text, the app will continue to send texts woth out you physically sending another, I had more than one supporter complain about this and we lost supporters because of it. It might be best to text people on your own and follow up, not through the app. Other than that, this was a fantastic amd easy fundraiser

Review.Titre: Raising Funds
Review.Contenu: I like being able to help kids raise funds for their school or project. I disliked that I couldn't give a lower amount than $25, so I ended up getting the popcorn for $10 and I really just wanted to give $10. So I would suggest a lower money value as an option.

Review.Titre: Personalize the fund raising witu a photograph of the student …
Review.Contenu: Taking the effort of one on one fund raising by the student seems like an easy way out. My loved one who is fund raising didn’t seem involved at all. At least your company could encourage the student to provide a photograph to personalize the machine operated solicitation !

Review.Titre: Good tracking; bad fees
Review.Contenu: I liked the ability to see how well my son was doing with his goal, but we received a lot of negative feedback and even some people didn’t want to donate when they heard how steep the service fees were. The coupons on the coupon card could be better targeted to businesses throughout the area the school zone covers versus concentrated in the northern part of the county. This is why I chose to donate versus buying cards.

Review.Titre: Much to learn, in my opinion
Review.Contenu: Your site was easy to use, but I very much disliked the follow-up requests for MORE money. I made a generous donation, yet your company makes the school look bad by continuing to ask for more. I’m sure it worked for you, but it is BAD donation-site practice. I would never recommend your company because of this low standard non-Southern practice.

Review.Titre: I would have preferred a dollar goal…
Review.Contenu: I would have preferred a dollar goal instead of a unit goal. We don’t like to ask friends to donate to our children’s activities and, instead, give the entire amount from our nuclear family. Because of the unit goal, we had to break up our donations into several smaller donations.  You made more money this way, but it cost us multiple service fees.

Review.Titre: A few things..
Review.Contenu: Would suggest a wider range of product options and colors. Also suggest allowing a make your own donation amount, 35$ -$50 as the lowest offerings can be hard for some, even as a one time donation. Our fundraiser was for highschool, being able to take 10$ 20$ donations mightve made an impact within the players peer groups. Including the ability to create and access a single account across different phones would also be helpful - my daughter ended up with 2 accounts during her fundraiser that we could not get combined for accurate rankings. **Please please please be transparent or make a large special note,that your system auto texts anyone added to the circle, we had no idea and had many people wondering why we kept sending them prompts over and over.

Review.Titre: Easy experience, but the texting was over the top
Review.Contenu: Easy experience, but very disappointed with how many texts I would get bombarded with about this raise. There needs to be a system where, once you've donated, the texts stop. In a world where we are constantly solicited, it is very annoying. I would happily donate again, but I dont need reminders to donate after I already have.

Review.Titre: Not everyone can afford your price…
Review.Contenu: Not everyone can afford your price point. I have eight grandchildren to try and support with fundraising. We should be able to give what we can instead of having to consider not giving anything.

Review.Titre: Kinda fishy
Review.Contenu: I liked how everything was automated and you could “compete” against your teammates. I hated the way they would automatically send messages to people in your contact list “via your team number” I had no idea this was happening and I felt as though I had no control.

Review.Titre: I liked the leaderboard and the…
Review.Contenu: I liked the leaderboard and the rankings but I wish it wasn’t the average units, but instead it was just what team had sold the most units in all. I also didn’t like that the app sent out texts for me because some of my contacts got very annoyed with that.

Review.Titre: Needs work
Review.Contenu: I love that my daughter was able to add me as a helper so that we could help push her fundraiser. I don’t like that through out the week that we used the app anyone we sent the link to then continued to get messages for the duration of the fundraiser nagging them to purchase and sent my daughter message over and over again. We also had issues with the fact that if they did not have an apple phone we had to find a new way to send the link as they were not receiving it.

Review.Titre: A bad fundraiser
Review.Contenu: I very much disliked that there was a $35 minimum to donate PLUS the credit card fee if you don’t want to purchase either of the 2 undesirable choices. I almost didn’t participate in this fundraiser. Decided to do it once but will never again.

Review.Titre: I don't know if this is a comment for…
Review.Contenu: I don't know if this is a comment for Money Dolly or the high school but I didn't like the fact that the $$ donation is more than if you actually bought a product. I also didn't like the fact that if you didn't donate when you 1st got the message you got additional messages until you donated. Please only send out 1 notice. If people can't donate you shouldn't pressure them into donating.

Review.Titre: Need something physical or concrete
Review.Contenu: It's hard to sell something people can't see or touch. It would be easier if there was a pamphlet, a handout, or a physical card. Especially for older people who aren't as tech savvy or for people who are in a hurry. It's also difficult to scan a QR code when you're already on your phone.

Review.Titre: Says time but not really
Review.Contenu: When trying to make one last donation it wouldn't let me although it said it had 2 hours 18 minutes until the fundraiser ended that was very frustrating and disappointing because the donor sent it to me to donate after she made several attempts. It never got donated

Review.Titre: More practical products, please.
Review.Contenu: I supported because it’s my granddaughter.  But I’d really like to see some different (and more practical) products for sale.  Cookie dough and popcorn are not my thing. Maybe candles?  Lightbulbs?  Wooden spoons?

Review.Titre: Dissatisfied
Review.Contenu: I do not feel that only digital cards should be available.  Many sales were list due to people not willing to deal with digital. Also the fees that were tacked onto the sale was not liked by many. When looking at the deals there are many not offered on our immediate location. I would be less likely to support this fundraiser next year.

Review.Titre: Wouldn't except some of the donations that people wanted to give!
Review.Contenu: I had people that wanted to donate, $15 and $10 so they input that in the other amount and it would not allow them to donate.  It said that you must donate a minimum of $20.00.  In my opinion, if someone wants to donate, it shouldn't matter the amount they want to give, at this time, every dollar counts.

Review.Titre: The app was easy to use but…
Review.Contenu: The app was easy to use, which I loved.  Unfortunately, the content (coupons) for the card that my daughter was selling was very limited.  Many of our friends and family had bought CMR or Bison cards from fall athletes and already had access to the other cards available through card connection.  It was tough to sell another $15 card that only added a couple of coupons.  This was a challenge for her last year too for the same reason. To improve sales, it would help to have a few more coupons offered on the swim team card.  Thank you for asking for feedback!

Review.Titre: Format of the app is poor
Review.Contenu: It is good that you are trying to offer more with the app compared to the physical card. But the extra is largely undermined by the poor format of the app. Either the offers should be sorted alphabetically by business, or there should be a search option. Just listing dozens of randomly thrown together. Businesses is really not very helpful. The benefit of being able to add more businesses during the duration of the card is also undermined by the fact that nobody is going to know because of the inability to find anything. These are fairly straightforward fix it so hopefully you will do that.

Review.Titre: I did not like that there was a set…
Review.Contenu: I did not like that there was a set minimum donation or the reminder texts. It made a few relatives feel pressured to donate and those that wanted to help but don’t have a lot of extra money, the minimum donation of $35 was hard to swing.

Review.Titre: Usability
Review.Contenu: The concept of helping our school team is great and the app works well.
